article.headline: The 'best' Trump interview yet? Fox News host Chris Wallace cheered - and also blasted - for his grilling of the president
article.body: President Trump is no fan of Fox News host Chris Wallace, having called him a "wannabe" who is "nasty and obnoxious" and "will never be his father," the legendary Mike Wallace of CBS News. This latest interview isn't helping. The two faced off on "Fox News Sunday" over the recent surge in coronavirus cases, mask wearing, tearing down statues and, of course, Joe Biden. Read: War of words between Trump and Fauci heats up In one particularly odd moment, they tangled over the president's cognitive test. Trump recently boasted that he "aced" such a test. "They said, 'That's an unbelievable thing. Rarely does anybody do what you just did,' " Trump told Fox News last week. "But [Biden] should take that same test." Wallace, making the point that "it's not the hardest test," highlighted one of the questions, which asks the test taker to identify a picture of an elephant. Key Words (February 2020):Dr. Ronny Jackson concedes he failed to get Trump to abide by his exercise prescription but was making diet inroads Then, when Wallace showed Trump a Fox News poll that found more Americans feel Biden is the more mentally fit of the two candidates, Trump issued a challenge. "Let's take a test right now," he said. "Let's go down, Joe and I will take a test. Let him take the same test that I took." iframe.twitter-tweet { width: 100% !important; } In another testy exchange, Wallace challenged Trump over his claims that Biden has called for defunding the police. The president asked a White House staffer to bring him proof, but, after flipping through a document that was brought to him, Trump, Wallace said, had been unable to show a Biden call for police-department defunding.
